Description: Round-topped limestone stela divided into five registers: 1 - Wedjat-eyes. 2 - Five columns of Hieroglyphic text flanked to the left by a representation of Ptah under a canopy and to the right by the standing figure of Amun. 3 - Seated figure before a loaded table and three standing male figures. 4 + 5 - Five kneeling figures separated by columns of Hieroglyphic text, the rightmost figure facing the others.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr Harry Reginald Holland Hall
Curator's comments: Published: HTBM Part 6 [Plate 26] Peet, Cemetries II, 111, [pl.XXIII, 3] PM V: p.65
